verbose_text: Moreover, cardiac magnetic resonance imaging is not mandatory for PPCM diagnosis, but in some cases it can rule out other differential diagnoses and improve assessment of morphology and function when echocardiography is inconclusive.1 In addition, it is noted that endomyocardial biopsy does not add any diagnostic or prognostic information in PPCM, but can be used to exclude acute myocarditis after delivery.14 Endomyocardial biopsy was performed around 3 months after the onset of symptoms and showed signs of chronic inflammation with increased levels of macrophages, lymphocytes, and actin filaments.
evidence: levels of macrophages, lymphocytes, and actin
